Die Konsumgüter- und Handelsbranche haben Sie schon immer fasziniert? Auf dem access Fast Moving Consumer Goods Career Event bringen wir Sie mit attraktiven Arbeitgebernzusammen, die Ihnen den Einstieg in die Welt der Waren ermöglichen! Die Veranstaltung findet am 26. September 2014 in Frankfurt statt. Bewerbungsschluss ist der 24. August 2014. Weitere Informationen finden Sie in der URL und im Anhang. [URL, Anhang] (Marketing-Career Services, 08.07.2014) Studentische/r Mitarbeiter/in im Marketing & Career Service. Im Marketing & Career Service der Universität Regensburg ist eine Stelle als studentische/r Mitarbeiter/in zu vergeben. Die Stelle ist ab dem 01.10.2014 für fünf Monate zu besetzen und umfasst 40 Stunden/Monat. Ihre Bewerbung schicken Sie bitte bis 11.07.2014 an mcs@ur.de. Weitere Informationen finden Sie im Anhang und in der URL. [URL, Anhang] (Marketing-Career Services, 26.06.2014) Studieren und Forschen in Australien und Neuseeland. Nach dem Bachelor ins Ausland? Universitäten in Australien und Neuseeland bieten eine Fülle an fachnahen und fachfremden Masterprogrammen an. Doch die Organisation eines Masterstudiums im Ausland erfordert einiges an Eigeninitiative und bringt viele Fragen mit sich. Wie finde ich die passende Universität? Welche Möglichkeiten der Finanzierung gibt es? Welche Unterlagen müssen eingereicht werden? Weitere Infos und Termine finden Sie in der URL und im Anhang. [URL, Anhang] (Marketing-Career Services, 11.06.2014) Heinz Nixdorf Stipendiatenprogramm. Das Heinz Nixdorf Programm zur Förderung der Asien-Pazifik-Erfahrung ermöglicht jungen deutschen Nachwuchsführungskräften sechsmonatige Berufserfahrung in asiatischen Ländern. Es vermittelt Einblicke in Arbeits- und Lebensbedingungen, in Wirtschafts- und Bildungssysteme der Gastländer, bereitet damit auf künftige Absatzmärkte vor und trägt zu globalem Denken und weltweiter Mobilität des Führungsnachwuchses bei. Weitere Infos finden Sie und er URL und im Anhang. [URL, Anhang] (Marketing-Career Services, 11.06.2014) Studentjob.de. StudentJob ist eines der größten Jobportale in Europa mit besonderem Fokus auf Studenten. StudentJob bietet den Studenten neben einem Job auch einen kostenlosen CV-Check an. Die ersten 100 Studenten, die sich bei uns melden bekommen ihn gratis! Mehr Informationen finden Sie in der URL und im Anhang. [URL, Anhang] (Marketing-Career Services, 08.05.2014) Umfrage zur Jobsuche. Im Rahmen einer Masterarbeit in Zusammenarbeit mit Academic Work Germany GmbH wird eine Studie zum Thema Jobsuche durchgeführt. Zielgruppe: Absolventen die vor Kurzem in Deutschland ihr Studium abgeschlossen haben und momentan auf Jobsuche sind oder das bald (bis Juni 2015) tun & sein werden. Alle Studiengänge sind interessant. Untersucht wird, wie & wo die Zielgruppe nach Jobs sucht und wie die Einstellung gegenüber Personaldienstleistern ist. Unter allen Teilnehmer werden fünf Amazon Gutscheine zu je 20 Euro verlost. [URL] (Marketing-Career Services, 30.04.2014) Continental: "Meet the Manager". Continental bietet seit letztem Jahr ein Programm namens "Meet the Manager" an. Beim diesjährigen Job-Shadowing-Event haben Studenten die einmalige Chance, einer weiblichen Top-Führungskraft von Continental einen ganzen Tag lang über die Schulter zu schauen und zu erfahren, wie in einem der führenden Technologie- und Automotive-Unternehmen Entscheidungen vorbereitet und getroffen werden. Weitere Informationen finden Sie in der beigefügten URL. [URL] (Marketing-Career Services, 25.04.2014) CLEVIS Praktikantenspiegel. Inspiriert durch das Interesse an den eigenen Praktikanten, hat die CLEVIS Group im Jahr 2010 die Studie ?Praktikantenspiegel? ins Leben gerufen. Das Ziel ist es, neue Erkenntnisse über die Attraktivität von Praktika zu erhalten. Teilnehmer erhalten bei der Befragung die Möglichkeit, mitzuteilen, wie sie die Arbeitgeberqualität während ihres Praktikums wahrgenommen haben. Zu der Befragung kommen Sie über diesen Link: http://www.equestionnaire.de/?q=11612&id=4017&a=b [URL] (Marketing-Career Services, 25.04.2014) Ausbildung zum Karrierecoach. Sämtliche Informationen zur Ausbildung und auch zur Anmeldung finden Sie im Anhang und über die URL. Die Veranstaltungen finden geblockt im Jahr 2015 statt. [URL, Anhang] (Marketing-Career Services, 15.04.2014) Rhetorikkurse und Workshops im WS 2013/14. Die Scheine und Teilnahmebestätigungen folgender Dozenten können ab sofort immer Montag-Freitag zwischen 09.00 und 12.00 Uhr im Büro des Marketing & Career Service (Raum RW(S) 133) abgeholt werden: Frau Höcker, Frau Zachmayer, Herr Lange, Frau Zander, Herr Rieder. (Marketing-Career Services, 13.03.2014) Rhetorikkurse SS 2013. Die Scheine und Teilnahmebestätigungen des Rhetorikkurses von Frau Voit und Workshops Zeitmanagement und Stressbewältigung von Herrn Endres können ab sofort Montag-Freitag von 09.00-12.00 Uhr im MCS-Büro (Raum RW(S) 133) abgeholt werden. (Marketing-Career Services, 22.08.2013) OSRAM Studententag 2013. OSRAM begrüßt alle Studenten/innen und Absolventen/innen aller technischer und kaufmännischer Studienrichtungen, bevorzugt aus den Bereichen Elektrotechnik,Optoelektronik, Physik, Mechatronik, Mikrosystemtechnik, Feinwerktechnik,Informatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen und Betriebswirtschaftslehre. Fachspezialisten der verschiedenen Abteilungen präsentieren den Studenten/innen die zahlreichen Möglichkeiten eines Praktikums, einer Abschlussarbeit, einer Werkstudententätigkeit oder einem Direkteinstieg in unserem Haus. Parallel finden interessante Fachvorträge statt. Anmeldeformulare finden Sie hier in der URL. Die Veranstaltung findet am 20. Juni 2013 statt. University of Regensburg (www.uni-regensburg.de) The university is a campus university, where 66 study programmes are taught. Our university applies the most modern standards to traditional fields of study such as business administration, economics or law, as well as to natural science and humanities. more... www-wiwi.uni-regensburg.de/Home/index.html.en Total number of students 16600 Faculty of Business, Economics and Management Information Systems 2222 Faculty of Law 1549 Faculty of Catholic Theology 374 Faculty of Medicine 1236 Faculty of Natural Sciences I ? Mathematics 1149 Faculty of Natural Sciences II ? Physics 485 Faculty of Natural Sciences III ? Biology and Preclinical Medicine 1323 Faculty of Natural Sciences IV ? Chemistry and Pharmaceutics 1090 Faculty of Philosophy I ? Philosophy, Arts and Social Sciences 1402 Faculty of Philosophy II ? Psychology, Paedagogy, Sports Science 1133 Faculty of Philosophy III ? Linguistics, Literature and Cultural Studies 4521 Faculty of Business, Economics and MIS (www-wiwi.uni-regensburg.de) Educational spectrum Since its foundation in 1967 the Faculty of Business has become an established educational institution of high-level research and practical orientation. With over 2.000 students the Faculty of Business, Economics and Management Information Systems is one of the biggest faculties at the University of Regensburg and offers a professional education in four disciplines: Business Administration, (International) Economics, Management Information Systems and Real Estate Management. more... Chairs in Business Administration Statistics Business Taxation Controlling and Logistics Financial Accounting and Auditing Financial Services Finance Leadership and Organization Innovation and Technology Management Marketing Strategic Industrial Marketing Chairs in Economics Empirical Macroeconomics and Regional Economics Financial Economics International and Monetary Economics Econometrics Theoretical Economics General Economics and Econometrics Chairs in Management Information Systems IT Finance Business Engineering Information Systems Management of Information Security Business Mathematics Chairs in Real Estate Management Real Estate Management Real Estate Finance Real Estate Economics Real Estate Law Degrees The Faculty offers bachelor degree programmes (Bachelor of Science) in ? Business Administration, ? (International) Economics (Middle and Eastern Europe) and ? Management Information Systems as well as master degree programmes (Master of Science) in ? Business Administration, ? (International) Economics (Middle and Eastern Europe), ? Management Information Systems and ? Real Estate Management. The Honors Study Programmmes in ? Business Administration, ? (International) Economics, ? Management Information Systems and are special elite study programmes for exceptionally dedicated and skilled students. more... Bachelor of Science The University of Regensburg is one of the first universities in Bavaria to have completed the Bologna process and is, therefore, able to offer the labor market a ?modern education product?: the Bachelor of Science. The graduates have learned theory and praxis of business studies, economics, international economics and management information systems within three semesters for the basic studies and two semesters of specialization, and have proved their capacity of working independently to complete their Bachelor Thesis. After the conversion to the double-stage education system, the Bachelor degree program has been accredited within the framework of a quality management system (QMS). Master of Science Master students deepen their expertise and skills which they have gained during their bachelor programmme during a four semester master programme. The master programmme is open not only for business graduates but also for bachelor graduates of other areas. All programmes are entirely organised in modules. They are ECTS-compatible and allow the intregation of exams which have been passed abroad. Bachelor and master programmes are characterised by their thorough procurement of basics and their wide range of major subjects. Honors Students The Honors Programmme at the University of Regensburg started in 2003. Since winter semester 2004/2005 the Regensburg Honors Programme is a part of the Elitenetzwerk Bayern (ENB; Elite Network Bavaria) and since then offers its own elite study programmes. Within the ENB the University of Regensburg has the highest number of Honors Students. The broad education is an important feature of the Honors Programme. Like no other business/economics master programme in Bavaria the Regensburg Honors Programmme is designed to procure extensive expertise and to prepare students for their future managerial function and international cutting-edge research. Webmaster · Intern

Our university applies the most modern standards to traditional fields of study such as business administration, economics or law, as well as to natural science and humanities. more... www-wiwi.uni-regensburg.de/Home/index.html.en Total number of students 16600 Faculty of Business, Economics and Management Information Systems 2222 Faculty of Law 1549 Faculty of Catholic Theology 374 Faculty of Medicine 1236 Faculty of Natural Sciences I ? Mathematics 1149 Faculty of Natural Sciences II ? Physics 485 Faculty of Natural Sciences III ? Biology and Preclinical Medicine 1323 Faculty of Natural Sciences IV ? Chemistry and Pharmaceutics 1090 Faculty of Philosophy I ? Philosophy, Arts and Social Sciences 1402 Faculty of Philosophy II ? Psychology, Paedagogy, Sports Science 1133 Faculty of Philosophy III ? Linguistics, Literature and Cultural Studies 4521 Faculty of Business, Economics and MIS (www-wiwi.uni-regensburg.de) Educational spectrum Since its foundation in 1967 the Faculty of Business has become an established educational institution of high-level research and practical orientation. With over 2.000 students the Faculty of Business, Economics and Management Information Systems is one of the biggest faculties at the University of Regensburg and offers a professional education in four disciplines: Business Administration, (International) Economics, Management Information Systems and Real Estate Management. more... Chairs in Business Administration Statistics Business Taxation Controlling and Logistics Financial Accounting and Auditing Financial Services Finance Leadership and Organization Innovation and Technology Management Marketing Strategic Industrial Marketing Chairs in Economics Empirical Macroeconomics and Regional Economics Financial Economics International and Monetary Economics Econometrics Theoretical Economics General Economics and Econometrics Chairs in Management Information Systems IT Finance Business Engineering Information Systems Management of Information Security Business Mathematics Chairs in Real Estate Management Real Estate Management Real Estate Finance Real Estate Economics Real Estate Law Degrees The Faculty offers bachelor degree programmes (Bachelor of Science) in ? Business Administration, ? (International) Economics (Middle and Eastern Europe) and ? Management Information Systems as well as master degree programmes (Master of Science) in ? Business Administration, ? (International) Economics (Middle and Eastern Europe), ? Management Information Systems and ? Real Estate Management. The Honors Study Programmmes in ? Business Administration, ? (International) Economics, ? Management Information Systems and are special elite study programmes for exceptionally dedicated and skilled students. more... Bachelor of Science The University of Regensburg is one of the first universities in Bavaria to have completed the Bologna process and is, therefore, able to offer the labor market a ?modern education product?: the Bachelor of Science. The graduates have learned theory and praxis of business studies, economics, international economics and management information systems within three semesters for the basic studies and two semesters of specialization, and have proved their capacity of working independently to complete their Bachelor Thesis. After the conversion to the double-stage education system, the Bachelor degree program has been accredited within the framework of a quality management system (QMS). Master of Science Master students deepen their expertise and skills which they have gained during their bachelor programmme during a four semester master programme. The master programmme is open not only for business graduates but also for bachelor graduates of other areas. All programmes are entirely organised in modules. They are ECTS-compatible and allow the intregation of exams which have been passed abroad. Bachelor and master programmes are characterised by their thorough procurement of basics and their wide range of major subjects. Honors Students The Honors Programmme at the University of Regensburg started in 2003. Since winter semester 2004/2005 the Regensburg Honors Programme is a part of the Elitenetzwerk Bayern (ENB; Elite Network Bavaria) and since then offers its own elite study programmes. Within the ENB the University of Regensburg has the highest number of Honors Students. The broad education is an important feature of the Honors Programme. Like no other business/economics master programme in Bavaria the Regensburg Honors Programmme is designed to procure extensive expertise and to prepare students for their future managerial function and international cutting-edge research. Webmaster · Intern

Bibliothek Rechenzentrum Verwaltung MCS Personalmesse Alumni Studienberatung Presse Ihr Ansprechpartner Marketing & Career Services Fakultät für Wirtschaftswissenschaften Universität Regensburg Telefon: 0941-943-2662 E-Mail: mcs@ur.de Web: www.mcs-regensburg.de MCS-Newsletter E-Mail: abonnieren abbestellen MCS-Partner Alle Partner unserer Fakultät anzeigen Service Personalmesse Personalmesse "Karriere Kontakte" Mittwoch, den 04. Juni 2014 im Foyer der Audimax Die Universität Regenburg veranstaltet die Firmenkontaktmesse ?Karriere-Kontakte?, um Studierenden und Unternehmen Gelegenheit zu geben, Kontakte aufzubauen und Profile auszutauschen. Die Messe ist ein erstklassiges Forum für den erfolgreichen Dialog zwischen Unternehmen und Studierenden. Personalverantwortliche und Führungskräfte aus den Fachabteilungen präsentieren ihr Unter-nehmen auf der Messe, zeigen Berufs- und Karriereperspektiven auf und lernen in persön-lichen Gesprächen Studierende und Absolventen kennen. Die "Karriere-Kontakte" ist für die teilnehmenden Firmen eine ideale Plattform für eine erfolgreiche Personalgewinnung und ein überzeugendes Personalmarketing! Für die Studierenden aller Fachrichtung bietet die Messe einen ganzen Tag Zeit, potenzielle Arbeitgeber kennenzulernen und sich bei den Unternehmen über Praktika, Abschlussarbeiten sowie den Berufseinstieg zu informieren. Sie können ihre Berufs- und Karriereperspektiven ausloten und sich frühzeitig ein berufliches Netzwerk aufbauen. Erfahren Sie mehr zur "Karriere-Kontakte" auf der Homepage: www.karriere-kontakte.de Webmaster · Intern

Bibliothek Rechenzentrum Verwaltung MCS Career Fair Alumni Studies Advisory Press Contact Marketing & Career Services Faculty of Business, Economics & MIS University of Regensburg Phone: +49 (0)941-943-2662 E-Mail: mcs@ur.de Web: www.mcs-regensburg.de MCS-Newsletter E-Mail: subscribe unsubscribe MCS-Partner Show all partners of the faculty Service Career Fair Career Event Career event "Karriere Kontakte" On Wednesday, 12th of June 2013, students of the University of Regensburg may establish personal contact with potential future employers for a whole day. For this occasion the foyer of the Audimax is converted into an exhibition and communication centre in order to ease the exchange of information in a comfortable atmosphere. Recruiters and managers from different departments present career entries to their enterprise to students and graduates: starting with internships, student trainee programmes up to direct entries. Enterprises may get to know potential employers and their profiles first-hand while effectively building up a good reputation. Our students have the opportunity to increase their knowledge and to leave a lasting positive impression on the exhibiting companies. Enterprises may not only present their company at their exhibition stand but also in lectures throughout the fair. Furthermore enterprises may conduct job interviews. Visit our homepage: www.karriere-kontakte.de Webmaster · Intern

Pressespiegel EUFIN 2014 will take place on 25 - 26 September 2014 at the University of Regensburg. For further information please see the link below (URL). [URL] (Sekretariat Faa, 12.09.2013) Prof. Dr. Tobias Just als Immobilienkopf des Jahres 2013 ausgezeichnet. Prof. Dr. Tobias Just, Geschäftsführer und Wissenschaftlicher Leiter der IREBS Immobilienakademie GmbH, wurde vom Fachmagazin Immobilienwirtschaft zum Immobilienkopf des Jahres 2013 gewählt. Eine Jury aus 21 renommierten Immobilien- und Finanzjournalisten vergab die Auszeichnung an insgesamt sechs führende Köpfe der Immobilienwirtschaft für ihre herausragenden Leistungen für die Branche. Die Auszeichnungen überreichte Bundesbauminister Dr. Peter Ramsauer. Als Begründung für die Ernennung zum Immobilienkopf des Jahres 2013 wurden die Immobilienexperten mit berühmten Persönlichkeiten aus der Luftfahrt verglichen. Alle Preisträger erhielten ein Portrait im Andy Warhol Pop Art Stil. Für die Laudatio wählte die Jury Antoine de Saint-Exupéry als Namenspatron für Tobias Just. Saint-Exupéry war leidenschaftlicher Pilot und Autor des bekannten Werkes ?Der kleine Prinz?. Tobias Just wurde insbesondere für seine wissenschaftlichen Leistungen zum Thema Demografie und Immobilien sowie sein Engagement für die öffentliche Förderung von demografiefesten Immobilien geehrt. ?Ich freue mich sehr über diese Auszeichnung?, sagt Tobias Just. ?Als praxisnah arbeitender Wissenschaftler ist es gut zu sehen, dass die Dinge, die man sagt und schreibt, auch wahrgenommen und geschätzt werden." Zu der Jury gehörten Reiner Reichel (Handelsblatt), Dr. Norbert Schwaldt (Die Welt), Manfred Gburek (Immobilienwirtschaft), André Eberhard (Der Immobilienbrief) sowie Andreas Remien (Süddeutsche Zeitung). Neben Tobias Just wurden Dr. Frank Billand (Chief Investment Officer Union Investment), Axel Gedaschko (Präsident GdW), Christoph Kahl (Geschäftsführender Gesellschafter Jamestown), Ulrich Höller (Vorstandsvorsitzender Deutsche Immobilien Chancen) und Christian Skrodzki (Vorstand Bahnhofsgenossenschaft Leutkirch) ausgezeichnet. Der Tag der Immobilienwirtschaft des ZIA wurde auf dem ehemaligen Flughafengelände in Berlin-Tempelhof ausgerichtet. Neben Top-Entscheidern aus der Branche waren die Bundesminister Dr. Wolfgang Schäuble, Dr. Peter Ramsauer und Peter Altmaier sowie Kanzlerkandidat Peer Steinbrück unter den geladenen Rednern. Die Preisverleihung fand in diesem Jahr erstmalig anlässlich der Jahresveranstaltung ?Tag der Immobilienwirtschaft? des ZIA Zentraler Immobilienausschuss e.V. statt. Der Award ?Immobilienkopf des Jahres? wird seit 2009 vergeben. (Institut Irebs, 07.06.2013) IREBS steht unter neuer Leitung. in: Mittelbayerische Zeitung, 21.05.2013 [URL] (Institut Irebs, 21.05.2013) Schlechte Fondsregulierung. in: Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, 09.11.2012 (Sandra Kullmann, 14.11.2012) Deutsche Immobilienblase ein Phantom. in: Die Welt, 23.10.2012 [URL] (Institut Irebs, 23.10.2012) [<<] [<] 1 2 3 4 5 [>] [>>] Webmaster · Intern

Zu der Jury gehörten Reiner Reichel (Handelsblatt), Dr. Norbert Schwaldt (Die Welt), Manfred Gburek (Immobilienwirtschaft), André Eberhard (Der Immobilienbrief) sowie Andreas Remien (Süddeutsche Zeitung). Neben Tobias Just wurden Dr. Frank Billand (Chief Investment Officer Union Investment), Axel Gedaschko (Präsident GdW), Christoph Kahl (Geschäftsführender Gesellschafter Jamestown), Ulrich Höller (Vorstandsvorsitzender Deutsche Immobilien Chancen) und Christian Skrodzki (Vorstand Bahnhofsgenossenschaft Leutkirch) ausgezeichnet. Der Tag der Immobilienwirtschaft des ZIA wurde auf dem ehemaligen Flughafengelände in Berlin-Tempelhof ausgerichtet. Neben Top-Entscheidern aus der Branche waren die Bundesminister Dr. Wolfgang Schäuble, Dr. Peter Ramsauer und Peter Altmaier sowie Kanzlerkandidat Peer Steinbrück unter den geladenen Rednern. Die Preisverleihung fand in diesem Jahr erstmalig anlässlich der Jahresveranstaltung ?Tag der Immobilienwirtschaft? des ZIA Zentraler Immobilienausschuss e.V. statt. Der Award ?Immobilienkopf des Jahres? wird seit 2009 vergeben. Press review EUFIN 2014 will take place on 25 - 26 September 2014 at the University of Regensburg. For further information please see the link below (URL). [URL] (Sekretariat Faa, 12.09.2013) Prof. Dr. Tobias Just als Immobilienkopf des Jahres 2013 ausgezeichnet. Prof. Dr. Tobias Just, Geschäftsführer und Wissenschaftlicher Leiter der IREBS Immobilienakademie GmbH, wurde vom Fachmagazin Immobilienwirtschaft zum Immobilienkopf des Jahres 2013 gewählt. Eine Jury aus 21 renommierten Immobilien- und Finanzjournalisten vergab die Auszeichnung an insgesamt sechs führende Köpfe der Immobilienwirtschaft für ihre herausragenden Leistungen für die Branche. Die Auszeichnungen überreichte Bundesbauminister Dr. Peter Ramsauer. Als Begründung für die Ernennung zum Immobilienkopf des Jahres 2013 wurden die Immobilienexperten mit berühmten Persönlichkeiten aus der Luftfahrt verglichen. Alle Preisträger erhielten ein Portrait im Andy Warhol Pop Art Stil. Für die Laudatio wählte die Jury Antoine de Saint-Exupéry als Namenspatron für Tobias Just. Saint-Exupéry war leidenschaftlicher Pilot und Autor des bekannten Werkes ?Der kleine Prinz?. Tobias Just wurde insbesondere für seine wissenschaftlichen Leistungen zum Thema Demografie und Immobilien sowie sein Engagement für die öffentliche Förderung von demografiefesten Immobilien geehrt. ?Ich freue mich sehr über diese Auszeichnung?, sagt Tobias Just. ?Als praxisnah arbeitender Wissenschaftler ist es gut zu sehen, dass die Dinge, die man sagt und schreibt, auch wahrgenommen und geschätzt werden." Zu der Jury gehörten Reiner Reichel (Handelsblatt), Dr. Norbert Schwaldt (Die Welt), Manfred Gburek (Immobilienwirtschaft), André Eberhard (Der Immobilienbrief) sowie Andreas Remien (Süddeutsche Zeitung). Neben Tobias Just wurden Dr. Frank Billand (Chief Investment Officer Union Investment), Axel Gedaschko (Präsident GdW), Christoph Kahl (Geschäftsführender Gesellschafter Jamestown), Ulrich Höller (Vorstandsvorsitzender Deutsche Immobilien Chancen) und Christian Skrodzki (Vorstand Bahnhofsgenossenschaft Leutkirch) ausgezeichnet. Der Tag der Immobilienwirtschaft des ZIA wurde auf dem ehemaligen Flughafengelände in Berlin-Tempelhof ausgerichtet. Neben Top-Entscheidern aus der Branche waren die Bundesminister Dr. Wolfgang Schäuble, Dr. Peter Ramsauer und Peter Altmaier sowie Kanzlerkandidat Peer Steinbrück unter den geladenen Rednern. Die Preisverleihung fand in diesem Jahr erstmalig anlässlich der Jahresveranstaltung ?Tag der Immobilienwirtschaft? des ZIA Zentraler Immobilienausschuss e.V. statt. Der Award ?Immobilienkopf des Jahres? wird seit 2009 vergeben. European Management and Business Sciences Consortium Die Universität Regensburg ist mit der Fakultät Wirtschaftswissenschaften Teil eines exklusiven Netzwerks europäischer Universitäten, die in wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Studiengängen die Teilnahme an einem integrierten europäischen Studium offerieren. Hintergrund ist die Förderung des europäischen Gedankens, der verstärkt in die nationalen Studienabschlüsse eingebunden werden soll. Für Studierende der Studiengänge Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Volkswirtschaftslehre, Internationale Volkswirtschaftslehre und Wirtschaftsinformatik bietet die Fakultät die Möglichkeit, im Rahmen fixierter Austauschprogramme zwei in den jeweiligen Studiengang integrierte, zusätzliche europäische Qualifizierungen zu erlangen: den "European Bachelor-Level Business Sciences" (EBBS) und den "European Master-Level Business Sciences" (EMBS). Die besondere europäische Komponente kommt dabei durch ein Zusatzmodul "European Affairs" zum Tragen, das an allen EMBS-Hochschulen angeboten wird. Es handelt sich dabei also nicht um einen eigenständigen Studiengang der Universität Regensburg mit Master Degree und auch nicht um einen Master-Studiengang an einer ausländischen Hochschule. Die Teilnehmer am EBBS/EMBS-Programm verbleiben vielmehr in ihrem ursprünglichen Regensburger Studiengang. Die während eines 2-semestrigen Studienaufenthalts bzw. 1-semestrigen (nur für Bachelor-Studierende) an einer ausländischen EMBS-Partnerhochschule zu erbringenden Prüfungsleistungen werden für das/den Regensburger Bachelor/Master anerkannt, notenmäßig umgerechnet und ausgewiesen. Das EMBS-Consortium der EMBS- Partnerhochschulen stellt ein eigenes EMBS-Zeugnis aus. Weitere Informationen zum EMBS-Consortium finden Sie unter www.embs-consortium.com. Hier finden Sie die akademischen Regeln für EBBS/EMBS-Studierende: EMBS Rules for Students (PDF). EMBS-Partnerhochschulen Die folgenden Hochschulen bilden das EMBS-Consortium. Bei den fett markierten Universitäten können Regensburger Studierende mit ERASMUS-Förderung platziert werden: University of Southern Denmark, Odense, Dänemark Ecole Supérieure de Commerce Bretagne Brest, Frankreich Ecole Supérieure de Commerce de Clermont, Frankreich Université Jean Moulin Lyon 3, Frankreich Ecole Supérieure de Commerce de Montpellier, Frankreich Ecole de Management de Normandie, Frankreich Otto-Friedrich-Universität Bamberg, Deutschland Universität Regensburg, Deutschland Universität Stuttgart, Deutschland Università degli Studi di Pavia, Italien Krakow University of Economics, Polen Universidad de Alcalá, Spanien ETEA - Universidad Loyola Andalucía, Córdoba, Spanien Universidad de Granada, Spanien University of Vaasa, Finnland Webmaster · Intern

F.A.Q. Studies Exchange Studies EMBS Studies at the Faculty of Business, Economics and Management Information Systems Here we present information on our Bachelor's studies in business administration, economics, international economics, or management information systems. Additionally we offer Master's studies in business administration, economics, international economics, management information systems, and real estate management. The Diploma's degree is going to be discontinued. European Management and Business Sciences Consortium Regensburg University and its Faculty of Business, Economics and Management Information Systems are part of an exclusive network of European universities that offer an integrated European program for business, economics and related studies. The background of this program is the advancement of the European idea, which shall be integrated further into national degree systems. The faculty offers students of Business Administration, Economics, International Economics and Business Information Systems the opportunity to achieve additional European qualifications, embedded in their exchange studies: The "European Bachelor-Level Business Sciences" (EBBS) and the "European Master-Level Business Sciences" (EMBS). The dedicated European component is the module "European Affairs", for which different courses are lectured at all EMBS universities. This is therefore not an independent program of Regensburg University, neither as a Master's degree here, nor as a Master's program at a university abroad. The participants stay enlisted in their regular studies. The courses completed abroad during the two-semester exchange (for bachelor students, one semester also possible) at an EMBS partner university are accepted as a course achievement in the Regensburg Bachelor/Master program. The EMBS consortium issues a separate EMBS certificate. Further information concerning the EMBS consortium can be found at www.embs-consortium.com. You can also read the academic rules for EBBS/EMBS students: EMBS Rules for Students (PDF). Universities participating in the EMBS consortium The following universities form the EMBS consortium. Those marked in bold letters are also ERASMUS partner universities of Regensburg University. University of Southern Denmark, Odense, Denmark Ecole Supérieure de Commerce Bretagne Brest, France Ecole Supérieure de Commerce de Clermont, France Université Jean Moulin Lyon 3, France Ecole Supérieure de Commerce de Montpellier, France Ecole de Management de Normandie, France Otto-Friedrich-Universität Bamberg, Germany Universität Regensburg, Germany Universität Stuttgart, Germany Università degli Studi di Pavia, Italy Krakow University of Economics, Poland Universidad de Alcalá, Spain ETEA - Universidad Loyola Andalucía, Córdoba, Spanien Universidad de Granada, Spain University of Vaasa, Finland Webmaster · Intern

F.A.Q. Studies Bachelor Studies at the Faculty of Business, Economics and Management Information Systems Here we present information on our Bachelor's studies in business administration, economics, international economics, or management information systems. Additionally we offer Master's studies in business administration, economics, international economics, management information systems, and real estate management. The Diploma's degree is going to be discontinued. Bachelor's program Recommended introductions: Bachelor program information brochure (German only) Flyer Bachelor Business Administration (German only) Flyer Bachelor Economics (German only) Flyer Bachelor International Economics (MOE) (German only) Flyer Bachelor Management Information Science (German only) Management Information Systems at UR (German only) Bachelor program detailed information (German only) Bachelor program structure (German only) Information for first-year students in Bachelor's studies Curricula: The following course schemes contain the Faculty's recommendation for the structure of your studies, i.e., which courses you should attend in the various semesters. Bachelor Business Administration (German only) Bachelor Economics (German only - Examination regulations of 2008) Bachelor Economics (German only - Examination regulations of 2011) Bachelor International Economics (German only) Bachelor Management Information Systems (German only - from WS 12/13) Bachelor Management Information Systems (German only - before WS 12/13) Module Catalogue The Module Catalogue (German only) states which courses belong to which modules as well as the weight (in terms of credit points) of the courses when calculating the final grades. Examination Regulations The Examination Regulations (German only) should be read carefully by every student. They are the legal basis of all studies and determine the achievements, that have to be completed in the course of your studies. Master's degree courses for Bachelor's degree students Students currently studying in a Bachelor's degree program of the Faculty may attend courses from our Master's degree programs under certain conditions. These courses can then be imported into the Master's degree in case of a successful application for the Master's degree program. Note that there are certain limitations regarding the import of examination results of Master's degree exams into the Bachelor's degree. All details can be found in the announcement of the Examination Office and on our FAQ page (German only). Webmaster · Intern

Important Links Flexnow Examination office Students chancellery International Office eLearning Master application portal Rent a locker Students advisory and complaints Course-specific advisory Studies advisory of the faculty Central studies advisory Dean of studies Students organizations Students coucil intouchCONSULT IRE|BS CORE AIESEC SIFE Frequently asked questions What is B.A./Economics/...? F.A.Q. Studies Bachelor Studies at the Faculty of Business, Economics and Management Information Systems Here we present information on our Bachelor's studies in business administration, economics, international economics, or management information systems. Additionally we offer Master's studies in business administration, economics, international economics, management information systems, and real estate management. The Diploma's degree is going to be discontinued. Bachelor's program Recommended introductions: Bachelor program information brochure (German only) Flyer Bachelor Business Administration (German only) Flyer Bachelor Economics (German only) Flyer Bachelor International Economics (MOE) (German only) Flyer Bachelor Management Information Science (German only) Management Information Systems at UR (German only) Bachelor program detailed information (German only) Bachelor program structure (German only) Information for first-year students in Bachelor's studies Curricula: The following course schemes contain the Faculty's recommendation for the structure of your studies, i.e., which courses you should attend in the various semesters. Bachelor Business Administration (German only) Bachelor Economics (German only - Examination regulations of 2008) Bachelor Economics (German only - Examination regulations of 2011) Bachelor International Economics (German only) Bachelor Management Information Systems (German only - from WS 12/13) Bachelor Management Information Systems (German only - before WS 12/13) Module Catalogue The Module Catalogue (German only) states which courses belong to which modules as well as the weight (in terms of credit points) of the courses when calculating the final grades. Examination Regulations The Examination Regulations (German only) should be read carefully by every student. They are the legal basis of all studies and determine the achievements, that have to be completed in the course of your studies. Master's degree courses for Bachelor's degree students Students currently studying in a Bachelor's degree program of the Faculty may attend courses from our Master's degree programs under certain conditions. These courses can then be imported into the Master's degree in case of a successful application for the Master's degree program. Note that there are certain limitations regarding the import of examination results of Master's degree exams into the Bachelor's degree. All details can be found in the announcement of the Examination Office and on our FAQ page (German only). Webmaster · Intern

FAQ Studium Master Hinweise zum Widerspruchsverfahren Studium an der Fakultät Wirtschaftswissenschaften Hier finden Sie Infos zu unseren Bachelor-Studiengängen Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Volkswirtschaftslehre, Internationale VWL oder Wirtschaftsinformatik. Zudem werden die Master-Studiengänge BWL, VWL, Internationale VWL, Wirtschaftsinformatik und Immobilienwirtschaft angeboten. Die Diplomstudiengänge laufen momentan aus. Hinweise zum Widerspruchsverfahren Wichtig: Die nachfolgenden Hinweise haben keinen rechtsverbindlichen Charakter. Es handelt sich hierbei lediglich um Ratschläge bzw. Hinweise, die auf den Erfahrungen der Studienberater der Fakultät basieren. Grundsätzlich besteht bei einem Ablehnungsbescheid die Möglichkeit, sich noch einmal (jedoch nicht mehrmals) in einem späteren Semester zu bewerben. Bitte machen Sie von dieser Möglichkeit Gebrauch, wenn sich in der Zwischenzeit etwas an Ihrer Qualifikation bzw. Eignung verändert hat. Falls Sie der Auffassung sind, dass ein auf Ihrem Bescheid aufgeführter Ablehnungsgrund unzutreffend ist, können Sie gegen den Ablehnungsbescheid Widerspruch einlegen. Bitte beachten Sie hierbei die Einspruchsfrist und die Vorgehensweise, die in der Rechtsbehelfsbelehrung, die dem Bescheid beigefügt ist, genannt wird. Falls Sie Widerspruch einlegen, ist dieser an den Dekan der Fakultät für Wirtschaftswissenschaften zu richten. Die Ablehnungsgründe ergeben sich aus §4 der Prüfungsordnung in Verbindung mit Anlage 1. Ein Widerspruch hat nur dann Aussicht auf Erfolg, wenn Sie darin klar und nachvollziehbar darlegen, warum die im Ablehnungsbescheid aufgeführten Ablehnungsgründe bei Ihnen unzutreffend sind. Der Widerspruch kann zwar formlos (d.h. als normaler Brief) eingelegt werden, Sie können die Bearbeitung jedoch erheblich vereinfachen, wenn die einzelnen Ablehnungsgründe und Ihre Erwiderung darauf aus der Struktur des Textes klar ersichtlich werden. Die Bearbeitung Ihres Widerspruchs kann wegen der erneuten Prüfung einige Wochen in Anspruch nehmen. Bitte nehmen Sie von Rückfragen zum Bearbeitungsstatus Abstand. Wir bemühen uns, Ihnen eine schnelle Rückmeldung zukommen zu lassen. Diese senden wir per Post an die bei der Bewerbung hinterlegte Adresse, es sei denn, Sie geben beim Widerspruch an, dass eine andere Adresse verwendet werden soll. Es gibt mehrere mögliche Fälle, wie diese Rückmeldung aussehen kann: Ihrem Widerspruch wird stattgegeben, d.h. der Bescheid wird geändert und Sie erhalten eine Zulassung. Der Ablehnungsbescheid wird unverändert aufrecht erhalten, da der Widerspruch unzutreffend ist. Sie erhalten dazu eine begründete Stellungnahme. Der Ablehnungsbescheid wird geändert, d.h. es werden andere Ablehnungsgründe genannt, die einer Zulassung entgegenstehen. Auch hierzu erhalten Sie eine begründete Stellungnahme. Für die Anfertigung der informellen Stellungnahme, die die Fakultät im Falle der Aufrechterhaltung der Ablehnung versendet, entstehen Ihnen keine Kosten. Wünschen Sie einen rechtsmittelfähigen Bescheid, ist dieser jedoch kostenpflichtig (75 EUR, Stand Juni 2010). Wenn Sie bei Ihrem Widerspruch einzelne Aspekte eines Ablehnungsgrundes widerlegen wollen und dies nicht anhand der Bewerbungsunterlagen, die Sie bereits eingereicht haben, nachvollziehbar ist, müssen Sie zusätzliche Nachweise bzw. Dokumente bereitstellen. Bitte beachten Sie jedoch, dass Unterlagen bzw. Prüfungsleistungen, die zum Zeitpunkt Ihrer Bewerbung nicht verfügbar waren, nicht nachträglich mit einem Widerspruch eingereicht werden können, um Ihre Qualifikation oder Eignung verbessern. Maßgeblich ist die Qualifikation und Eignung zum Zeitpunkt der Bewerbung. Erläuterungen zu einzelnen Ablehnungsgründen Die nachfolgende Aufstellung soll Verständnisfragen klären, die in der Vergangenheit bei einigen Ablehnungsgründen in der Studienberatung beantwortet wurden. Diese Informationen sollen Ihnen helfen, die einzelnen Ablehnungsgründe besser zu verstehen. Wegen der Vielzahl an Bewerbungen, die durch unsere Faukltät bearbeitet werden müssen, möchten wir Sie möglichst bitten, von individuellen Rückfragen abzusehen. Vielen Dank! Es konnte kein einschlägiger Hochschulabschluss oder gleichwertiger Abschluss nachgewiesen werden, dessen inhaltliche und methodische Anforderungen denen des jeweiligen Bachelorstudiengangs an der Universität Regensburg entsprechen (Prüfungsordnung §4 Abs. 2). Sie haben bei Ihrer Bewerbung möglicherweise keinen einschlägigen (also thematisch verwandten) Hochschulabschluss nachgewiesen. Möglicherweise ist der Abschluss zwar einschlägig, jedoch ist er hinsichtlich der inhaltlichen bzw. methodischen Anforderungen nicht mit dem zugehörigen Bachelor-Studiengang vergleichbar. Kein Beleg für einschlägiges Wissen im Bereich XXX, nachgewiesen durch mind. 24 Kreditpunkte, die einem der Module XXX, XXX, XXX oder XXX zuzuordnen sind. Die Masterstudiengänge an der Fakultät für Wirtschaftswissenschaften sind konsekutiv, d.h. sie bauen inhaltlich direkt auf die zugehörigen Bachelorstudiengänge an der Fakultät auf. Um den Master-Studiengang erfolgreich studieren zu können, ist es daher erforderlich, dass Sie einen Studiengang besucht haben, in dem Sie Kenntnisse in Themengebieten erlangt haben, die einem der Schwerpunkte des Bachelorstudiengangs an unserer Fakultät entsprechen. Dies ist durch den Besuch von Kursen (nicht Seminaren oder durch die Bachelorarbeit!) im Umfang von mind. 24 Kreditpunkten nachzuweisen. Diese Kurse müssen inhaltlich den Kursen bzw. Themengebieten der Schwerpunkte in unserer Fakultät entsprechen. Aus den Unterlagen geht offenbar nicht hervor, dass in dem qualifizierenden Studiengang, mit dem Sie sich für den Master-Studiengang bewerben, entsprechende Kurse im geforderten Umfang besucht wurden. Die Kurse, die zu den Schwerpunkten gehören, können den Studienablaufplänen auf der Internetseite der Fakultät entnommen werden. Methodenkompetenz im Bereich Mathematik für Wirtschaftswissenschaftler, Statistik und zusätzlich bei den Masterstudiengängen Volkswirtschaftslehre und IVWL (MOE) im Bereich Ökonometrie konnte nicht nachgewiesen werden. Aus Ihren Unterlagen war offenbar nicht ersichtlich, dass Sie Kurse aus den genannten Themengebieten besucht haben bzw. waren die erzielten Leistungen nicht ausreichend, um die geforderte Methodenkompetenz nachzuweisen. Leistungsbereitschaft, dokumentiert beispielsweise durch gute Studienleistungen, insbesondere in Fächern, die dem jeweiligen Masterstudiengang zuzuordnen sind, kurze Studienzeit oder intensiv verfolgte außerfachliche Aktivitäten, konnte nicht nachgewiesen werden. Die bei Ihrer Bewerbung angegebene bzw. nachgewiesene Abschluss- oder Durchschnittsnote ist offenbar entweder schlechter als die in der Prüfungsordnung genannte Mindestnote (2,5) oder die Leistungen in den Fächern, die dem Masterstudiengang zugeordnet sind, also z.B. Fächer aus einzelnen Studienschwerpunkten, sind nicht gut genug. Es werden hierbei lediglich die Leistungen betrachtet, die zum Zeitpunkt der Bewerbung offiziell nachgewiesen sind. Leistungen, die im laufenden Semester erbracht werden, können nicht herangezogen werden. Offenbar lieferten Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen auch keine weiteren Anhaltspunkte, die Rückschluss auf Ihre Leistungsbereitschaft zuließen. Motivation, dokumentiert beispielsweise durch absolvierte Nebenfächer, absolvierte Praktika, einschlägige Berufspraxis, konnte nicht nachgewiesen werden. Aus Ihren Bewerbungsunterlagen ging offenbar nicht deutlich genug hervor, dass Sie motiviert sind, den Studiengang, auf den Sie sich beworben haben, zu studieren. Fähigkeit, erlernte Methoden und erworbenes inhaltliches Wissen bei der Einordnung und Bewertung wirtschaftlicher Sachverhalte sowie bei der Beantwortung konkreter Fragestellungen einzusetzen, konnte nicht nachgewiesen werden. Offenbar war aus Ihren Unterlagen nicht genügend ersichtlich, dass der qualifizierende Studiengang bzw. die darin vermittelten Inhalte einen ausreichenden Bezug zu dem gewünschten wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Master-Studiengang haben. Es wurde kein Abschlusszeugnis vorgelegt bzw. ein Nachweis über die bisherigen Prüfungsleistungen im Umfang von mindestens 150 Kreditpunkten konnte nicht erbracht werden (Prüfungsordnung §4 Abs. 5). Die Prüfungsordnung fordert, dass Sie zum Zeitpunkt der Bewerbung mindestens 150 Kreditpunkte im qualifizierenden Studiengang nachweisen. Es ist dabei nicht ausschlaggebend, ob Sie diese Schwelle im Laufe des aktuellen Semesters überschreiten. Webmaster · Intern

Bibliothek Rechenzentrum Verwaltung Themenverbund "Immobilien- und Kapitalmärkte" (Englisch) World record algorithm is presented in Frankfurt. One of the 50 best inventions of the world - With a world record algorithm researchers at the University of Regensburg and the University of applied sciences have repeatedly gained attention. The applications in the chemical industry, the developers of Prof. Dr. Ingo Morgenstern (University of Regensburg) and Dr. John Schneider (Mainz) will present at the "ACHEMA 2012" of 18 to 22 June 2012 in Frankfurt. A press conference will be held on Monday, 18 June 2012, at 3 p.m. (ACHEMA 2012, Frankfurt, room "ratio" in Hall 9.1). For additional information, see the attachment. [Anhang] (Melanie Wagner-Hauber, 24.05.2012) Lecture Series. Lecture "Physics and Financial Crisis" by Prof. Dr. Ingo Morgenstern on 18 January 2012 [Anhang] (Melanie Wagner-Hauber, 19.01.2012) Home Alliance "Real Estate and Capital Markets" The alliance "Real Estate and Capital Markets? at the University of Regensburg is a joint initiative of the Faculties of Law and Economics, composed of members of the Faculty of Philosophy, Art and Social Sciences and the Faculty of Physics. The association of the different disciplines offers the possibility to examine the driving mechanism and the framework of real estate and capital markets and their interactions as broadly as possible. Lecture "Physics and Financial Crisis" by Prof. Dr. Ingo Morgenstern on 18 January 2012 [Anhang] (Melanie Wagner-Hauber, 19.01.2012) Home Alliance "Real Estate and Capital Markets" The alliance "Real Estate and Capital Markets? at the University of Regensburg is a joint initiative of the Faculties of Law and Economics, composed of members of the Faculty of Philosophy, Art and Social Sciences and the Faculty of Physics. The association of the different disciplines offers the possibility to examine the driving mechanism and the framework of real estate and capital markets and their interactions as broadly as possible. Bibliothek Rechenzentrum Verwaltung Themenverbund "Immobilien- und Kapitalmärkte" (Englisch) World record algorithm is presented in Frankfurt. One of the 50 best inventions of the world - With a world record algorithm researchers at the University of Regensburg and the University of applied sciences have repeatedly gained attention. The applications in the chemical industry, the developers of Prof. Dr. Ingo Morgenstern (University of Regensburg) and Dr. John Schneider (Mainz) will present at the "ACHEMA 2012" of 18 to 22 June 2012 in Frankfurt. A press conference will be held on Monday, 18 June 2012, at 3 p.m. (ACHEMA 2012, Frankfurt, room "ratio" in Hall 9.1). For additional information, see the attachment. [Anhang] (Melanie Wagner-Hauber, 24.05.2012) Lecture Series. Lecture "Physics and Financial Crisis" by Prof. Dr. Ingo Morgenstern on 18 January 2012 [Anhang] (Melanie Wagner-Hauber, 19.01.2012) Teaching Alliance "Real Estate and Capital Markets" By the alliance the University of Regensburg strengthens her jurisprudential and economic profil. Interested students gain an extensive insight into cause-effect relationships between real estate and capital markets. Depending on intention, functional direction and target degree a monodisciplinary or interdisciplinary access can be chosen. Different courses of study including lecture series and interdisciplinary seminars create incentives even during the study to deal with phenomena of the interconnected markets interdisciplinary. Moreover far-reaching cooperations with renowned companies in real estate and financial markets give students the opportunity to measure the theory on the practice and the practice on the theory. Thus the alliance constitutes the framework in which students receive important stimuli to forward to industry and research. Currently the alliance contains manifold university study paths and final degrees. In cooperation with the IREBS Immobilienakademie, Eltville and the VWA OstBayern, Regensburg moreover several postgraduate professional studies are offered. Faculty of Economics Bachelor of Science (B. Sc.) Business administration (Emphases on Arrangement of Reporting and Accounting and Taxation and/or Real Estate Industry) Economics (Emphases on Financial Markets and/or Real Estate and Regional Economics) Information Systems (Emphasis on Information Systems in Financial Institutions and Information Security) Further Informations Master of Science (M. Sc.) Business administration (Emphases on Finance, Real Estate and/or Quantitative Finance) Economics (Emphases on Financial Markets and/or Real Estate and Regional Economics) Information Systems (Emphasis on Information Systems in Financial Institutions ? IT Finance) Real Estate (Emphases on Real Estate Investment and Finance, Real Estate Development and Management, Real Estate and Regional Economics) Further Informations Fakulty of Law Emhasis on Real Estate and Infrastructure Law (Building Law, Planning Law, Public Procurement Law, Subsidy Law, Competition Law, Telecommunications Law, Energy Law, Transport Law) Further Informations Emphasis on Company Law Emphasis on Capital Market Law Webmaster · Intern

Bibliothek Rechenzentrum Verwaltung Öffentlichkeitsbeauftragter der WiWi-Fakultät Prof. Dr. Andreas Otto Profile Publications Map Contact Phone +49 941 943-2685 Fax +49 941 943-3187 E-Mail (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) WWW http://www-wiwi.uni-r... Office location RWL 314 Office hours nach Vereinbarung Members Prof. Dr. Andreas Otto Prof. Dr. Andreas Otto Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") The chair conducts research in the area of distribution management. In close relationship to the alliance the chair works on locations decisions and expected changes in the location patterns of logistics buildings. Short biography Dr. Otto is full professor for business administration at University of Regensburg where he teaches classes on logistics and supply chain management, management accounting (controlling) and decision support in logistics. Prior to this Dr. Otto served as product manager for ?Order Fulfillment? within the global business unit Supply Chain Management at SAP AG, Walldorf, Germany. Prior to this, he served as associate professor at university of Nuremberg, Germany from 1997 to mid of 2000. From 1994 to mid of 1997 he has been with the Dachser Corporation in Munich, Germany, where he served as head of corporate controlling. Dr. Otto received a doctor of business administration and a professorial dissertation from the university of Erlangen-Nuremberg, Germany. Webmaster · Intern

Office location RW(L) 321 Office hours Nach Vereinbarung Members Prof. Dr. Axel Haller Prof. Dr. Axel Haller Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") Fields of research related to the alliance ?Real Estate and Capital Markets? are in particular the presentation of real estate in the external reporting instruments of entities according to national and international standards. In addition, the members of the department also have research interest in the recognition of intangible values in corporate reporting. The research perspective in this respect is quite broad and includes intangible assets such as trademarks, costumer relations, patents, licenses and others, as well as the incorporation of the sustainability principle in the corporate governance of entities. Short biography April 1985: Diploma in Accounting, Auditing and Law at the University of Augsburg February 1989: Ph.D. in Business Administration January 1994 - March 1996: Research Grant from ?German Research Foundation? (Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft) July 1996: Habilitation February 1997: Appointment as Assistant Professor WS/SS 1997/98: Representative of the professorship of General Business Management at the University of Cologne WS 1998/99: Representative of the professorship of the seminar of trustee relationship at the University of Cologne (Chair Prof. Dr. Sieben) April 1999 - September 2004: Professor and Head of the Department of Accounting and Auditing at Johannes Kepler University Linz (Austria) Since October 2004: Professor and Head of the Department of Financial Accounting and Auditing at the University of Regensburg Current tasks in the self-administration of the University Member of the board of the Faculty of Business, Economics and Management Information Systems Member of the examination board of the Faculty of Business, Economics and Management Information Systems Member of the Budget Committee of the University Member of the working group "studies and teachings" of the University Numerous Lectureships and Visiting Professorships at home and abroad Lectureships at the Universities of Konstanz, Osnabrück, Stuttgart and at Leipzig Graduate School of Management Visiting Professorships at the Universities of Graz, Wien and Linz (Austria), Metz and Rouen (France), University of Cincinnati (USA) Teaching and Research Activities amongst others at the University of Washington, Seattle, Virginia Politec Institute and State University, Blacksburg, VA, Rice University of Virginia, Huston, Texas, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign, Illinois, University of Washington, Seattle, Washington (USA), London School of Economics and Political Science (Great Britain), HEC School of Management, Paris (France), University of Lund (Sweden), University of Edinburgh (Scotland), University of Cordoba (Spain), University of Nisc (Serbia), Graduate School of Management Jönsköping (Sweden), University of Sydney (Australia), University of Colorado, Boulder (USA), San Diego State University (USA), Stockholm School of Economics (Sweden) Member of the Working Groups `Externe Unternehmensrechnung` and `Immaterielle Vermögenswerte` of the Schmalenbach-Gesellschaft e.V., Member of several boards of editors of national and international academic journals Webmaster · Intern

Prof. Dr. Bernd Heinrich Prof. Dr. Bernd Heinrich Contact Imprint Privacy Navigation Studium Fakultäten Aktuelles Alumni Europaeum Forschung Internationales Klinikum Kultur und Freizeit Mensa Presse RUL Sportzentrum Sprachenzentrum Studierende aktiv Universität Hilfe... Bibliothek Rechenzentrum Verwaltung Prof. Dr. Bernd Heinrich Profile Publications Contact Phone +49 941 943-6101 Fax +49 941 943-6120 E-Mail (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) WWW http://www-wiwi.uni-r... Office location VG 3.37 Office hours nach Vereinbahrung Members Prof. Dr. Bernd Heinrich Prof. Dr. Bernd Heinrich Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") Forschungsthemen Die Forschungsthemen umfassen sowohl theoretische als auch praxisrelevante Fragestellungen der Wirtschaftsinformatik insbesondere mit Bezug zu Finanzdienstleistern: Prozessmanagement, -simulation und -planung Flexibilisierung von Prozessen mit Hilfe semantischer Web Services Planung und Entwicklung von Location-based Services und Applikationen auf mobilen Endgeräten Messung der Daten-/Informationsqualität und ökonomische Planung von Datenqualitätsmaßnahmen Diffusion von Plattformen im Bereich Online Social Networks und Social Media Short biography Bernd Heinrich born in 1972, received his diploma in Business Informatics from the University of Regensburg in 1999 and specialized in the fields of Information Engineering, Information Systems in the financial services industry, and Operations Research. From 1999 to 2002, he worked as a Research Assistant at the Chair of Information Management of Prof. Dr. Robert Winter at the University of St. Gallen (Switzerland). His doctoral thesis is on Information Systems Architectures and Customer Relationship Management. From 2002 to 2008, Bernd Heinrich worked as an Assistant Professor of Business Informatics at the Department of Information Systems Engineering & Financial Management of Prof. Dr. Hans Ulrich Buhl at the University of Augsburg (Germany). During this time, he was responsible manager of several research groups and conducted a number of applied research projects (e.g. together with Siemens AG, Fujitsu Siemens Computers GmbH, HypoVereinsbank AG, and Allianz AG). Moreover, he had the leading responsibility for fundraising, content and management of the fundamental research project "Semantic based modeling, self-composition, and self-configuration of reference processes (SEMPRO)", which was founded by the German Research Foundation (DFG). Moreover, he was also significantly involved in acquiring the approved consecutive research project SEMPRO2 founded by the German Research Foundation (DFG). In 2007, he habilitated ("venia legendi") in the field of Information Systems Architectures, Data Quality, Semantic-based Process Management, and Communication Standards. For this work, he received the Scientific Award of the Federal State Bank of Bavaria and the Research Award of the UPM-Kymmene GmbH. In addition, he received the Scientific Award of the Kurt and Felicitas Viermetz Foundation according to his extraordinary engagement and excellent work for enhancing the reputation and the prestige of the Business Administration Faculty of the University of Augsburg. Moreover, he successfully acquired the fundamental research project "Automated Planning of Process Models" funded by the Austrian Science Fund (FWF), which will end in 2016. Since October 2011, Bernd Heinrich holds the Chair for Information Systems II at the Department of Information Systems at the University of Regensburg. Bernd Heinrich serves as a reviewer, track chair and associate editor for several international journals and conferences. He has published numerous articles in books and well-known research journals as for example Zeitschrift für Betriebswirtschaft (ZfB), Die Betriebswirtschaft (DBW), Die Wirtschaftsinformatik (Business & Information Systems Engineering), Electronic Markets (EM), Information Systems and E-Business Management (ISeB), Journal of Information Science (JIS), Business Process Management Journal (BPMJ), Academy of Marketing Science Review, Journal of Information Science, and ACM Journal of Data and Information Quality (JDIQ). Moreover, he presented his research at renowned international conferences such as International Conference on Information Systems (ICIS), European Conference on Information Systems (ECIS), International Conference on Information Quality (ICIQ), and International Conference on Business Informatics (Internationale Tagung Wirtschaftsinformatik). His main research interests are Data and Information Quality especially in the field of Customer Relationship Management at financial services providers, Process planning and simulation, Decision models for an economic-oriented Standard and Platform Adoption (e.g. in the field of Online Social Networks), Service-oriented Architectures and the use of Web services to realize flexible processes at banks, and Planning and Development of Location-based Services and Applications on Mobile Devices. Webmaster · Intern

Office location VG 3.37 Office hours nach Vereinbahrung Members Prof. Dr. Bernd Heinrich Prof. Dr. Bernd Heinrich Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") Forschungsthemen Die Forschungsthemen umfassen sowohl theoretische als auch praxisrelevante Fragestellungen der Wirtschaftsinformatik insbesondere mit Bezug zu Finanzdienstleistern: Prozessmanagement, -simulation und -planung Flexibilisierung von Prozessen mit Hilfe semantischer Web Services Planung und Entwicklung von Location-based Services und Applikationen auf mobilen Endgeräten Messung der Daten-/Informationsqualität und ökonomische Planung von Datenqualitätsmaßnahmen Diffusion von Plattformen im Bereich Online Social Networks und Social Media Short biography Bernd Heinrich born in 1972, received his diploma in Business Informatics from the University of Regensburg in 1999 and specialized in the fields of Information Engineering, Information Systems in the financial services industry, and Operations Research. From 1999 to 2002, he worked as a Research Assistant at the Chair of Information Management of Prof. Dr. Robert Winter at the University of St. Gallen (Switzerland). His doctoral thesis is on Information Systems Architectures and Customer Relationship Management. From 2002 to 2008, Bernd Heinrich worked as an Assistant Professor of Business Informatics at the Department of Information Systems Engineering & Financial Management of Prof. Dr. Hans Ulrich Buhl at the University of Augsburg (Germany). During this time, he was responsible manager of several research groups and conducted a number of applied research projects (e.g. together with Siemens AG, Fujitsu Siemens Computers GmbH, HypoVereinsbank AG, and Allianz AG). Moreover, he had the leading responsibility for fundraising, content and management of the fundamental research project "Semantic based modeling, self-composition, and self-configuration of reference processes (SEMPRO)", which was founded by the German Research Foundation (DFG). Moreover, he was also significantly involved in acquiring the approved consecutive research project SEMPRO2 founded by the German Research Foundation (DFG). In 2007, he habilitated ("venia legendi") in the field of Information Systems Architectures, Data Quality, Semantic-based Process Management, and Communication Standards. For this work, he received the Scientific Award of the Federal State Bank of Bavaria and the Research Award of the UPM-Kymmene GmbH. In addition, he received the Scientific Award of the Kurt and Felicitas Viermetz Foundation according to his extraordinary engagement and excellent work for enhancing the reputation and the prestige of the Business Administration Faculty of the University of Augsburg. Moreover, he successfully acquired the fundamental research project "Automated Planning of Process Models" funded by the Austrian Science Fund (FWF), which will end in 2016. Since October 2011, Bernd Heinrich holds the Chair for Information Systems II at the Department of Information Systems at the University of Regensburg. Bernd Heinrich serves as a reviewer, track chair and associate editor for several international journals and conferences. He has published numerous articles in books and well-known research journals as for example Zeitschrift für Betriebswirtschaft (ZfB), Die Betriebswirtschaft (DBW), Die Wirtschaftsinformatik (Business & Information Systems Engineering), Electronic Markets (EM), Information Systems and E-Business Management (ISeB), Journal of Information Science (JIS), Business Process Management Journal (BPMJ), Academy of Marketing Science Review, Journal of Information Science, and ACM Journal of Data and Information Quality (JDIQ). Moreover, he presented his research at renowned international conferences such as International Conference on Information Systems (ICIS), European Conference on Information Systems (ECIS), International Conference on Information Quality (ICIQ), and International Conference on Business Informatics (Internationale Tagung Wirtschaftsinformatik). His main research interests are Data and Information Quality especially in the field of Customer Relationship Management at financial services providers, Process planning and simulation, Decision models for an economic-oriented Standard and Platform Adoption (e.g. in the field of Online Social Networks), Service-oriented Architectures and the use of Web services to realize flexible processes at banks, and Planning and Development of Location-based Services and Applications on Mobile Devices. Webmaster · Intern

Office location RW(S) 214 Office hours Mittwoch, 16 Uhr Members Prof. Dr. Daniel Roesch Prof. Dr. Daniel Roesch Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") Professor Dr. Daniel Rösch holds the chair in Statistics and Risk Management at the University of Regensburg. Prior to joining the University of Regensburg in 2013 he was Professor of Finance and Director of the Institute of Banking of Finance at the Leibniz University of Hannover from 2007 to 2013. He earned a Ph.D. (Dr. rer. pol.) from the University of Regensburg in 1998 for a work on empirical Asset Pricing. From 2006 to 2011 he was visiting researcher at The University of Melbourne. Since 2011 he is visiting Professor at the University of Technology in Sydney. His research interests cover Banking, Quantitative Financial Risk Management, Credit Risk, Asset Pricing, and Empirical Statistical and Econometric Methods and Models. He published numerous papers in leading international journals, earned several awards and honors, and regularly gives talks on major international conferences. As a service to the profession he is currently President of the German Finance Association, co-founder and member of the board of directors of the Hannover Center of Finance, and deputy managing director of the workgroup Finance and Financial Institutions of the Operations Research Society. He also serves on the editorial board of the Journal of Risk Model Validation. Professor Rösch has cooperated with financial institutions and supervisory bodies such as Deutsche Bundesbank in joint research projects. Among others, his work has been funded by Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft, the Thyssen Krupp Foundation, the Frankfurt Institute for Finance and Regulation, and the Melbourne Centre for Financial Studies. He currently participates in a long-term research grant with academics from the University of Technology in Sydney which is supported by the Australian Centre for International Finance and Regulation. Webmaster · Intern

Office location RW(L) 308 Members Prof. Dr. Dirk Meyer-Scharenberg Prof. Dr. Dirk Meyer-Scharenberg Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") The research interest emphases on specialities from taxation of real estate investment of individuals and companies in Germany and abroad. The chair focuses on the optimisation of equity and debt financing as well as the conception of closed-end property-based funds. Short biography Prof. Dr. Meyer-Scharenberg graduated in business administration at the University of Munich in 1992. After working for an auditing company, he became research assistant at the chair of Prof. Dr. Biergans at the University of Munich from 1982 until 1990, where he earned his doctorate in 1984 and habilitated in 1990. After calls to the Universities of Hamburg, Jena and Leipzig he holds the chair for Corporate Taxation at the University of Regensburg since October 1992. Webmaster · Intern

Prof. Dr. Enzo Weber Prof. Dr. Enzo Weber Contact Imprint Privacy Navigation Studium Fakultäten Aktuelles Alumni Europaeum Forschung Internationales Klinikum Kultur und Freizeit Mensa Presse RUL Sportzentrum Sprachenzentrum Studierende aktiv Universität Hilfe... Bibliothek Rechenzentrum Verwaltung Stellv. Geschäftsführer des Instituts für VWL einschl. Ökonometrie Prof. Dr. Enzo Weber Profile Publications Contact Phone +49 941 943-1952 Fax +49 941 943-4917 E-Mail WWW http://www-wiwi.uni-r... Office location RW(L) 513 Office hours Mo 15-16 nach Vereinbarung Members Prof. Dr. Enzo Weber Prof. Dr. Enzo Weber Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") Our interest in the research group comprises the intersections of econometric methodology, empirical macroeconomics, quantitative analysis of financial markets and application to real estate markets. These areas offer attractive topics and synergies. For instance, financial and macroeconometrics depend on appropriate methods from time series analysis. The development of such methods is often initiated by new subject-matter problems. Furthermore, econometric modelling and interpretation of statistical results require clear connections to economic theory. An important example is given by the recent real estate, financial and real economic crisis. Obviously, the different crisis names reveal the potential of research in the intersections of the mentioned areas. Concerning crisis propagation, interest focuses on analysing market interdependencies. In terms of financial econometrics this brings identification of causal effects and modelling of market volatility to the fore. Closely connected research fields are the formation of risk premia and the behaviour of liquidity flows. Concrete applications to real estate markets are planned in the following directions: First, the interaction of different funds, segments and such. Here, incidence and characteristics of contagion impacts are central, above all under the aspect of suitable policies for preventing and managing further crises. Second, interaction of real estate sector, money markets and real macroeconomy. A highly topical area lies in the role of expansive interest rate policy for the development of real estate prices and its repercussions on money and capital markets. Regarding private agents, results serving the improvement of liquidity and portfolio management shall be uncovered. Short biography Stefanie Huber: http://www-wiwi.uni-regensburg.de/Personen/Stefanie-Birgit-Huber.html.en Sabine Klinger: http://www.iab.de/en/ueberblick/mitarbeiter.aspx/Mitarbeiter/407 Enzo Weber: http://www.iab.de/754/section.aspx/Mitarbeiter/56703 Webmaster · Intern

Office location VG 217 Office hours Mi. 11:00 - 12:00 Members Prof. Dr. Gabriel Lee Prof. Dr. Gabriel Lee Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") There is no description of research fields within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") available yet. Short biography Professor Gabriel S. Lee studied mathematics and economics at the University of Alberta (B.Sc.) and economics at the University of Western Onatario (M.A. Economics). He then obtained his Ph.D. (Economics) at the University of Chicago with the dissertation titled `Housing Investment under Time to Build and Adjustment Costs?. Before joining the University of Regensburg, he held positions at various institutions such as at the University of Pittsburgh, the University of California, Davis, the University of Vienna and Innsbruck, and at the Intitute for Advanced Studies in Vienna. Since april 2004, he holds the chair professorship for real estate economics at the University of Regensburg. Professor Lee's main research focuses on real estate topics in the context of macroeconomics. Webmaster · Intern

Office location 219 Office hours Dienstag 15 - 16 Uhr Members Prof. Dr. Gerrit Manssen Prof. Dr. Gerrit Manssen Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") Professor Manssen?s research field within the Alliance is the regulation of land use, which has a significant influence on the value of the land. It ranges from zoning building land to highly differentiated specific land-use types for example in order to control the retail trade. The research project also covers the variety of legal urban development legal measures ? conventional and progressive ? which could possibly be taken. All measures infringe the constitutionally guaranteed right to property and have to be justified. For this reason they can only be recommended to the communities if they are likely to be accepted by the administrative courts. Short biography Professor Manssen is editor and author of many publications in the field of public law. Webmaster · Intern

Office location VG 3.05 Members Prof. Dr. Gregor Dorfleitner Prof. Dr. Gregor Dorfleitner Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") The Department of Finance deals with many different empirical and theoretical topics in the field of capital markets. Selected areas of interest are: Derivatives, credit risk, sustainable investment, micro finance, bond and stock markets, valuation and risk modelling of businesses. Short biography After a degree in mathematics with business administration as a second field of study at the University of Augsburg, Gregor Dorfleitner received his doctorate for his studies concerning index futures in the Department of Statistics of the University of Augsburg in 1998. In 2003 he habilitated in the Department of Business and Economics at the same university. From 2004 on, he served as full professor of finance at the Vienna University of Economics and Business where he became head of the newly implemented Financial Engineering and Derivatives Group. Since October 2007 he has been head of the Department of Business Administration, especially Finance, and since April 2008 director of the Center of Finance at the University of Regensburg. Professor Dorfleitner has published numerous papers in internationally renowned scientific papers. CV downloadable at http://www-wiwi-cms.uni-regensburg.de/images/institute/bwl/dorfleitner/assets/cv_gd_engl.pdf Webmaster · Intern

Office location RW(S) 106a Office hours nach Vereinbarung Members Prof. Dr. Guido Schryen Prof. Dr. Guido Schryen Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") Application of quantitative decision support methods (operations research) for participants in real estate and capital markets. Short biography Trained in computer science, information systems and operations research at RWTH Aachen University (Germany), Guido Schryen works in the fields of quantitative decision support (operations research), benefits of information systems and services, and IT security. After research visits to Stanford University and Queensland University of Technology (Brisbane, Australia), he received a doctorate in information systems from the RWTH Aachen University with a thesis on component-based software engineering and earned a post-doctorate degree (habilitation/venia legendi) at the RWTH Aachen University with a thesis on the analysis and design of countermeasures against e-mail spam. From May 2007 to March 2011, he held a position as Assistant Professor at the Institute of Business Information Systems, RWTH Aachen University. From September 2008 to August 2009, he joined the International Computer Science Institute (ICSI) at Berkeley (USA), sponsored by the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD). From October 2009 to Juli 2010 and from October 2010 to March 2011, he was temporary professor of Information Systems Research at the University of Freiburg and at the Christian-Albrechts-Universität zu Kiel, respectively. Since April 2011, Guido Schryen is professor of Information Systems Research at the University of Regensburg. He is also member of the advisory board of the ?Bavarian IT Security and Safety Cluster? (member of The Kompetenznetze Deutschland initiative of the Federal Ministry of Economics and Technology) and member of the advisory board of the ?Forum IT-Security? of the ?Bavarian IT Security and Safety Cluster?. Webmaster · Intern

Members Prof. Dr. Dr. Herbert Grziwotz Prof. Dr. Dr. Herbert Grziwotz Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") the focus of the topic cluster is the connection of urban development and real estate transactions. additional topics of research are the philosophical essentials of the fair city, the regard of sustainability in city planning and the contractual equity of the real estate business. Short biography prof. dr. dr. Herbert Grziwotz, year of birth 1954. he studied law and science of history at the university of munich, notary in regen/zwiesel, guest lecturer at the academy of federal finance, member of the board of adviser of the institute of notary law at the university of würzburg, member of the scientific advisory committee of the German institute of notary; faculty on public law. associate editor of the periodical of real estate law,of the compendium of real estate law and of law of real property developers , member of the board of adviser of editors of the MDR and the MittBayNot. Webmaster · Intern

Office location VG 203 Office hours nach Vereinbarung Members Prof. Dr. Karl-Werner Schulte, HonRICS Prof. Dr. Karl-Werner Schulte, HonRICS Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") The ECE Endowed Professorship concentrates on the aspects of corporate governance of real estate companies, mainly on incorporated companies in an international context. Another core area is the generation of listed real estate investments and transparent real estate and capital markets in African countries (especially sub-saharan Africa). Short biography Professor Dr. Karl-Werner Schulte was born in 1946 in Warstein (North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany). He was awarded a Doctoral Degree in 1974 at the University of Münster. In 1986 he was appointed Chair of Business Administration, in particular Investment and Finance, at the EUROPEAN BUSINESS SCHOOL International University Schloss Reichartshausen (ebs). In 1990 he founded the ebs REAL ESTATE ACADEMY and has been its academic and managing director until 2006. In 1994, he held the Endowed Chair of Real Estate at ebs, which became later the ebs Department of Real Estate by the appointment of further professors and was lead by Professor Dr. Schulte for several years. In autumn 2006 he moved, together with most of his colleagues, to the International Real Estate Business School (IRE|BS) at the University of Regensburg. Since then Professor Dr. Schulte is the holder of the ECE Endowed Professorship and scientific director of the IRE|BS REAL ESTATE ACADEMY. Professor Dr. Karl-Werner Schulte is founding president of the gif (German Society of Property Researchers) and was president of the European Real Estate Society (ERES) and the International Real Estate Society (IRES). Currently he is responsible for promoting Real Estate Education and Research in Africa as an IRES Director. Professor Dr. Schulte has been elected as an Honorary Member of the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (HonRICS), the German Society of Property Researchers (gif) and the Real Estate Alumni Organisations (IMMOEBS). For his outstanding achievements in the academic field he received the IRES Service Award in 1999, in 2001 the ERES Achievement Award and in 2005 the Award of Excellence of the German Council of Shopping Centers e.V as well as the ULI Germany Leadership Award in 2008 and the Immobilienmanager Lifetime Award in 2009. The American real estate institution CRE Counselors of Real Estate has accepted Professor Dr. Schulte as first German member. As a member of numerous advisory and editorial boards of renowned real estate companies and academic journals, Professor Dr. Schulte links practical and theoretical aspects of real estate. Webmaster · Intern
