Prof. Dr. Martin Wentz Prof. Dr. Martin Wentz Contact Imprint Privacy Navigation Studium Fakultäten Aktuelles Alumni Europaeum Forschung Internationales Klinikum Kultur und Freizeit Mensa Presse RUL Sportzentrum Sprachenzentrum Studierende aktiv Universität Hilfe... Bibliothek Rechenzentrum Verwaltung Prof. Dr. Martin Wentz Profile Publications Contact E-Mail WWW http://www-wiwi.uni-r... Office hours Nach Vereinbarung Members Prof. Dr. Martin Wentz Prof. Dr. Martin Wentz Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") Subject of the Honorary Chair for Urban Development is investigating the development of cities, their risks and opportunities in the public and private planning processes. Also the analysis of the stakeholders, interests and interactions take centre stage. The political and economic contexts of urban planning are taken into special consideration. Within the alliance there are interfaces to the fields of spatial planning, urban economics, real estate development, architecture, land use strategy, urban sociology as well as planning and building law. Research topics of the Honorary Chair of Urban Development are for example strategic approaches to urban development, socio-political approaches to urban planning, new forms of urban governance, a shift in the inner cities and sub-centers and the future of the city. Short biography Born in 1945. 1970 completed the studies of physics with a diploma degree, 1974 received the PhD (Dr. phil. nat.) at the Institute of Applied Physics. In 1989 elected City Councilor - Head of the Department for Urban Planning. Founder of the `Wentz Concept Projektstrategie GmbH` and editor to numerous publications on the topics of town planning, urban developments and regional planning, including the serie `The Future of Urbanity`, Campus-Verlag. Webmaster · Intern

Office location V.G. 3.46 Office hours Termin nach Vereinbarung Members Dipl.-Kfm. Dipl.-Geogr. Matthias Segerer Dipl.-Kfm. Dipl.-Geogr. Matthias Segerer Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") Herr Segerer befasst sich mit der Funktionsweise des Handelsimmobilienmarktes. Schwerpunkt hierbei ist die Erklärung des Angebots an und der Nachfrage nach Handelsimmobilien auf Grundlage von Theorien der Immobilienwirtschaft und der Handelsforschung. Short biography Von September 2002 bis Mai 2009 studierte Matthias Segerer im Rahmen seines Doppelstudiums Diplom-Geographie und Diplom-Betriebswirtschaftslehre mit den Schwerpunkten Immobilienmanagement, Ökonomie des Öffentlichen Sektors, Personal und Organisation, Statistik, Raumbezogene Information, Verkehrs- und Stadtgeographie an der Universität Regensburg. Praktische Erfahrung sammelte er im Bereich der Verkehrsforschung bei der Bayerischen Eisenbahngesellschaft mbH in München, im Bereich Handelsforschung bei der IHK Regensburg für Oberpfalz/Kelheim und im Bereich der Immobilienprojektentwicklung bei der Küblböck Projektentwicklung GmbH in Regensburg. Seit Mai 2009 ist Herr Segerer wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter an der Professur für Handelsimmobilien an der Universität Regensburg (Prof. Dr. Kurt Klein). Working Paper: SEGERER, Matthias(2010): Is there a link between spatial theories and retail property Investments within the urban area? The situation of German discounters. Konferenze der European Real Estate Society (ERES) in Mailand. [http://www.eres2010.org/contents/papers/id172.pdf] Aufsätze: SEGERER, M. (2011): Immobilienwirtschaft und Discounter ? ausgewählte theoretische Ansätze und erste empirische Befunde anhand des Lebensmitteleinzelhandels in Bayern. In: Jürgens, U. (Hrsg.): Discounterwelten. Reihe Geographische Handelsforschung. (Aufsatz eingereicht und angenommen) SEGERER, M. (2011): Geographische Informationssysteme in der Immobilienwirtschaft. Praxiseinsatz und Konzeptionsmöglichkeiten. Selbstverlag des Instituts für Immobilienwirtschaft. 40 S. (= Beiträge zur Immobilienwirtschaft, Heft 1). Regensburg. Webmaster · Intern

Short biography Melanie Wagner Hauber graduated with a Bachelors of Business Administration with focus on real estate industry at the University of Regensburg after a completed apprenticeship as a lawyer?s assistant. Subsequently she completed the Master?s degree programme in Real Estate at the IRE|BS International Real Estate Business School with focus on real estate and regional economics as well as real estate investment and finance. During her studies she worked as a student assistant at the Chair of Real Estate Economics and for the Professorship of Urban Development and gained practical experience at the HypoVereinsbank and the Media-Saturn-Holding. Since November 2010 Melanie Wagner Hauber is research assistant at the Chair of Real Estate Finance at the University of Regensburg. Webmaster · Intern

(Universität Regensburg); MScRE in Finance and Investment (University of Reading) Peter Geiger Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") Schwerpunkt soll, mit Blick auf den Triple-Bottom-Line-Ansatz, die Implementierung von Nachhaltigkeitsaspekten und-strategien in das Haus der Immobilienwirtschaft sein. Short biography Peter Geiger studierte nach dem Abitur am Camerloher Gymnasium in Freising Betriebswirtschaftslehre an der Universität Regensburg mit dem Abschluss Diplom-Kaufmann. Schwerpunkte des Studiums lagen auf den Bereichen Immobilienmanagement und -finanzierung sowie Immobilienökonomie. Desweiteren absolvierte Peter Geiger ein Masterstudium (Master of Science) in Immobilieninvestment und -finanzierung in Großbritannien an der Henley Business School der University of Reading. Seit Dezember 2010 ist Peter Geiger als Wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter am IRE|BS Kompetenzzentrum für Nachhaltigkeit in der Immobilienwirtschaft. Webmaster · Intern

Philip-Christian Ebeling Dipl.-Kfm. Philip-Christian Ebeling Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") The contribution to the research group is the analysis of the implementation of the Corporate Governance Codex of the German real estate industry in practice. Furthermore a prototype annual financial statement should be developed. Short biography Philip-Christian Ebeling passed his A-Levels in 2000 at the Giordano Bruno high school in Perugia, Italy. Following this, he did his community service in a neighborhood watch in Munich, Germany. Between 2003 and 2007 he studied business administration at the European Business School, Schloß Reichertshausen in Oestrich-Winkel with Real Estate and Finance & Banking as his majors. During his studies he gathered practical work experience among others at the Hypovereinsbank AG, the Depfa Bank Plc. and the Albis Leasing AG. Furthermore he gathered additional international experience at the Universidad de San Andrés, Buenos Aires, Argentina and at the University of Western Australia, Perth, Australia. In 2007 he finished his university studies as ?Diplom-Kaufmann? (equivalent to Master in Business Administration). After his studies he worked as banking consultant in Zurich, Switzerland for 3 years. From August 2010 until December 2012 Philip-Christian Ebeling was research assistant of Prof. Dr. Karl-Werner Schulte HonRICS who continues to be his doctoral advisor. Since January 2012 Philip-Christian Ebeling works as research assistant of Prof. Dr. Karl-Werner Schulte´s successor, Prof. Dr. Tobias Just. Philip-Christian Ebeling expects to finish his dissertation by mid 2012. Webmaster · Intern

Philip-Christian Ebeling Dipl.-Kfm. Philip-Christian Ebeling Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") The contribution to the research group is the analysis of the implementation of the Corporate Governance Codex of the German real estate industry in practice. Furthermore a prototype annual financial statement should be developed. Short biography Philip-Christian Ebeling passed his A-Levels in 2000 at the Giordano Bruno high school in Perugia, Italy. Following this, he did his community service in a neighborhood watch in Munich, Germany. Between 2003 and 2007 he studied business administration at the European Business School, Schloß Reichertshausen in Oestrich-Winkel with Real Estate and Finance & Banking as his majors. During his studies he gathered practical work experience among others at the Hypovereinsbank AG, the Depfa Bank Plc. and the Albis Leasing AG. Furthermore he gathered additional international experience at the Universidad de San Andrés, Buenos Aires, Argentina and at the University of Western Australia, Perth, Australia. In 2007 he finished his university studies as ?Diplom-Kaufmann? (equivalent to Master in Business Administration). After his studies he worked as banking consultant in Zurich, Switzerland for 3 years. From August 2010 until December 2012 Philip-Christian Ebeling was research assistant of Prof. Dr. Karl-Werner Schulte HonRICS who continues to be his doctoral advisor. Since January 2012 Philip-Christian Ebeling works as research assistant of Prof. Dr. Karl-Werner Schulte´s successor, Prof. Dr. Tobias Just. Philip-Christian Ebeling expects to finish his dissertation by mid 2012. Webmaster · Intern

Office location RWS 229 Office hours siehe Homepage Members Prof. Dr. Roland Helm Prof. Dr. Roland Helm Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") The main contribution is the customer-oriented development and pricing of real estate for B2B-markets as well as the controlling of the interactive project planning and construction processes. The knowledge in this area derives from the same typical questions and problems which are relevant for the development of industrial products and services in B2B-marktes. Short biography Prof. Dr. Roland Helm holds the Chair of Strategic Industrial Marketing at the University of Regensburg since October 2010. From 2000 to 2010 he held the Unilever-Chair of Marketing at the Friedrich-Schiller-University Jena (Germany). Previously he worked at Munich University of Technology and at the University of Augsburg. He received a diploma degree in Business Administration from the University of Regensburg and the European Business Management School of the University of Wales (E.M.B.S.), a PhD and the Habilitation in Business Administration from the University of Augsburg. Prof. Helm was born in 1966. Webmaster · Intern

Geschäftsführer des IREBS Instituts für Immobilienwirtschaft Prof. Dr. Steffen Sebastian Profile Publications Map Contact Phone +49 (941) 943-5081 Fax +49 (941) 943-815080 E-Mail (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) WWW http://www-wiwi.uni-r... Office location VG 208 Office hours Aufgrund Forschungsfreisemester ausnahmsweise nur nach Vereinbarung Members Prof. Dr. Steffen Sebastian Prof. Dr. Steffen Sebastian Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") The focus of research at the Department of Real Finance is real estate as an investment for institutional and private investors. Within this, indirect investments such as open and closed-end funds, property companies or REITs are a major theme. This includes empirical investigation as well as regulatory aspects. Another research focus is the integration of real estate in the strategic asset allocation of institutional investors. The real estate investment by private investors is examined in the context of so-called life-cycle models. The research is interdisciplinary in particular in the areas of capital market law and the programming of optimizations and simulations. Short biography Steffen Sebastian is Professor of Real Estate Finance at the IRE|BS International Real Estate Business School and director at the Center for Finance University of Regensburg, Germany. Furthermore, he is a research associate of the Centre for European Economic Research (ZEW), Mannheim. He holds a graduate diploma in Business Administration from the University of Mannheim (Germany) and from ESSEC (France). He also holds a Doctor degree from the University of Mannheim (Germany) and a Habilitation degree from Goethe-University, Frankfurt (Germany). His research focuses are, among indirect real estate investments, real estate indices, real estate derivatives and asset allocation. He has contributed to a number of academic journals and is a member of the editorial board of European Journal of Real Estate Research and the German Journal of Property Research. Webmaster · Intern

Prof. Dr. Stephan Bone-Winkel Prof. Dr. Stephan Bone-Winkel Contact Imprint Privacy Navigation Studium Fakultäten Aktuelles Alumni Europaeum Forschung Internationales Klinikum Kultur und Freizeit Mensa Presse RUL Sportzentrum Sprachenzentrum Studierende aktiv Universität Hilfe... Bibliothek Rechenzentrum Verwaltung Prof. Dr. Stephan Bone-Winkel Profile Publications Contact Phone +49 941 943-6024 Fax +49 941 943-6022 E-Mail (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) (punkt) WWW http://www-wiwi.uni-r... Office location PT 5.0.04 Office hours nach Vereinbarung Members Prof. Dr. Stephan Bone-Winkel Prof. Dr. Stephan Bone-Winkel Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") The teaching and research approach for real estate development in Regensburg covers the interdisciplinary management of planning and construction orientated value creating processes in a real estate?s life-cycle. These include the components acquisition, use-concept and feasibility analysis, creating building permit, finding equity and debt, marketing and leasing, project management and property desinvestment. In the Themenverbund context there are interfaces in the areas of project financing, investment and portfoliomanagement, real estate asset management as well as in architecture, urban development, organizationaldevelopment, sociology, planning and construction law. Current research topics of the Honorary Professorship of Real Estate Development are e.g. sustainability in real estate portfolios, revitalization and financing of real estate assets, the management of corporate real estate, new instruments of feasibility analysis and the performance of office properties. Short biography Dr. Stephan Bone-Winkel was born in 1965. He graduated from the University of Cologne, Germany with a degree in business administration. From 1990 to 1993 Dr. Bone-Winkle held a research assistant position at the European Business School (ebs), where he also earned his PHD. Until 1996 he acted as managing director of the ebs real estate academy, and built up the Berlin subsidiary. After having worked at Deutsche Bank AG as property developer, he co-founded BEOS-GmbH in Berlin 1997 an has been working as managing director since then. From 2003 to 2006 he was appointed to the endowed chair of Real Estate Development at the European Business School and is now honorary professor for Real Estate Development at the University of Regensburg, International Real Estate Businss School. Office location PT 5.0.04 Office hours nach Vereinbarung Members Prof. Dr. Stephan Bone-Winkel Prof. Dr. Stephan Bone-Winkel Research field within the Alliance ("Themenverbund") The teaching and research approach for real estate development in Regensburg covers the interdisciplinary management of planning and construction orientated value creating processes in a real estate?s life-cycle. These include the components acquisition, use-concept and feasibility analysis, creating building permit, finding equity and debt, marketing and leasing, project management and property desinvestment. In the Themenverbund context there are interfaces in the areas of project financing, investment and portfoliomanagement, real estate asset management as well as in architecture, urban development, organizationaldevelopment, sociology, planning and construction law. Current research topics of the Honorary Professorship of Real Estate Development are e.g. sustainability in real estate portfolios, revitalization and financing of real estate assets, the management of corporate real estate, new instruments of feasibility analysis and the performance of office properties. Short biography Dr. Stephan Bone-Winkel was born in 1965. He graduated from the University of Cologne, Germany with a degree in business administration. From 1990 to 1993 Dr. Bone-Winkle held a research assistant position at the European Business School (ebs), where he also earned his PHD. Until 1996 he acted as managing director of the ebs real estate academy, and built up the Berlin subsidiary. After having worked at Deutsche Bank AG as property developer, he co-founded BEOS-GmbH in Berlin 1997 an has been working as managing director since then. From 2003 to 2006 he was appointed to the endowed chair of Real Estate Development at the European Business School and is now honorary professor for Real Estate Development at the University of Regensburg, International Real Estate Businss School.
